pause_integration_results.error: An error occurred while trying to suspend the integration: {{error}}

resume_integration_results.error: An error occurred while trying to resume the integration: {{error}}

setup.temporary_add_integration_error: An error occurred while preparing your integration: {{error}}

add_integration_results.error: An error occurred while trying to add the integration: {{error}}

delete_integration_results.error: An error occurred while trying to delete the integration: {{error}}

edit_integration_results.error: An error occurred while trying to update the integration: {{error}}

get_integration_results.error: Could not load this integration. You have been redirected to your integrations overview page. (Details: {{error}})

get_verification_results.error: An error occurred while trying to connect to your integration.
get_verification_results.disconnected: Could not verify your integration with the data you provided.
get_verification_results.credential_validation_error: The credentials you provided are not valid.
get_verification_results.insufficient_privilege_error: The provided user has insufficient privileges.
get_verification_results.timezone_mismatch_error: Your external system timezone doesn't match the timezone of your integration. Adjust your invalid timezone.
get_verification_results.cloud_link_connection_error: No connection to Cloud Link, verify your Cloud Link installation.

delete_confirmation.title: Delete integration
delete_confirmation.introduction: This integration will be deleted from injixo.
delete_confirmation.warning_list:
• All imported queues will be retained.
  • If you add the integration again, new queues with the same name will be added.

cancel_confirmation.title: Are you sure?
cancel_confirmation.description: You have already estabished a connection to your injixo Cloud Link, which will be lost when you proceed. To connect your injixo Cloud Link to a new integration, it has to be restarted to generate a new PIN.

setup.authentication_error: Could not authenticate user. Please log in again.

integration_name.label: Name
integration_name.validation: Enter a custom name for the integration.

agent_status_active.explanation: Check this checkbox if you want to import agent status data from your database.
agent_status_active.label: Import agent status data

download.explanation: Download the installer that fits your operating system. Learn more in <explanationLinkText>Help Center</explanationLinkText>.

connect.explanation: During the installation of injixo Cloud Link, your terminal shows a PIN that you need to proceed. It will expire after 5 minutes.
connect.label: PIN shown during installation
connect.not_claimable: This integration can not be connected to an injixo Cloud Link.
connect.error: The PIN is incorrect. Make sure that the PIN hasn't expired. If you are unsure, simply restart the injixo Cloud Link to generate a new PIN and try again.
connect.new_cloud_link: Connect a new installation of injixo Cloud Link

csv_schema.title: CSV schema configuration
csv_schema.explanation: The CSV schema is used to read and process your CSV file. If you want to import CSV files with different formats, you need to set up separate CSV integrations for each format.
csv_schema.validation: You need to create a CSV schema
csv_schema.schema_exists: CSV schema has been saved successfully

type.explanation: You can only select one type of import data at a time. To import data from another type, create a new integration.
type.label: Type of import data
type.validation: Select the type of import data

api_key.label: injixo API key
api_key.placeholder: The API key will be shown after generating
api_key.create_info: The section Access injixo API becomes available after saving the integration. Then, you can generate the injixo API key.

modal.title: Re-generate an injixo API key
modal.info: When the new injixo API key is generated:
modal.key_deleted: the current API key will be deleted.
modal.key_exchange: you need to exchange the current API key with the new API key in the injixo app inside Freshdesk.

freshdesk.title: Install injixo app
freshdesk.app_info: It enables injixo to import data from Freshdesk continuously.

guide.go_to_marketplace: Go to the <stepLinkText>injixo app page</stepLinkText> in Freshdesk Apps marketplace.
guide.paste_api_key: <bold>Paste</bold> the generated API key into the corresponding field on the injixo app installation page.

api_key.label: injixo API key

modal.info: When the new injixo API key is generated:
modal.key_deleted: the current API key will be deleted.
modal.key_exchange: you need to exchange the current API key with the new API key.
modal.title: Re-generate an injixo API key

api_key.placeholder: The generated API key will be shown here.

api_section.create_info: To generate the injixo API key, you need to save the integration.

guide.go_to_marketplace: Go to the <externalLinkText>injixo app page</externalLinkText> in Freshdesk Apps marketplace.
guide.paste_api_key: Paste the generated API key into the corresponding field on the injixo app installation page.

freshdesk.info: It enables injixo to import data from Freshdesk continuously.

modal.key_deleted: the current API key will be deleted.
modal.key_exchange: you need to exchange the current API key with the new API key in the injixo app inside Freshdesk.

freshdesk.title: Install injixo app

guide.go_to_marketplace: Go to the <externalLinkText>injixo app page</externalLinkText> in Freshdesk Contact Center Apps marketplace.
guide.paste_api_key: Paste the generated API key into the corresponding field on the injixo app installation page.
guide.activate_agent_status: (Optional) Check the agent status checkbox to import real-time agent status data.

freshdesk_contact_center.info: It enables injixo to import data from Freshdesk Contact Center continuously.

modal.key_deleted: the current API key will be deleted.
modal.key_exchange: you need to exchange the current API key with the new API key in the injixo app inside Freshdesk Contact Center.

freshdesk_contact_center.title: Install injixo app

guide.go_to_marketplace: Go to the <externalLinkText>injixo app page</externalLinkText> in Freshchat Apps marketplace.
guide.paste_api_key: Paste the generated API key into the corresponding field on the injixo app installation page.

freshchat.info: It enables injixo to import data from Freshchat continuously.

modal.key_deleted: the current API key will be deleted.
modal.key_exchange: you need to exchange the current API key with the new API key in the injixo app inside Freshchat.

freshchat.title: Install injixo app

api_section.info: The API key enables access to the injixo API.

integration_configuration_id.copied_tooltip: Copied integration configuration ID to clipboard
integration_configuration_id.label: Integration configuration ID

api_section.title: Access injixo API

setup.dropdown_placeholder_timezone: Search or select a time zone
setup.cloud_link_not_connected: Your injixo Cloud Link is not connected.

user_credentials.title: User credentials
user_credentials.explanation: Enter valid credentials for a user with administrator role.

account_region.label: Account region
account_region.explanation: Select the region of your Five9 account.

grouping.label: Group queues by
grouping.explanation: Select how you want to group your queues. Note that skill-based grouping requires setting up a custom report in your Five9 account.

credentials.title: User credentials
credentials.explanation: Enter a valid client ID and client secret for your Vonage ACD. Consult the Vonage documentation on how to get a client ID and client secret.

region.explanation: Select the region of your Vonage account.
region.label: Account region

grouping.explanation:
Select how you want to group your queues. The selection cannot be changed once it has been saved.
The Vonage queues option combines data from queue type, queue name, and interaction plan.
grouping.label: Group queues by

account.explanation: To get access to your data, enter your Talkdesk account name.

client.explanation: Enter a valid client ID and client secret for your Talkdesk ACD. Talkdesk can provide you with user credentials for ACD access.

account_region.explanation: Select the region of your Talkdesk account.
account_region.label: Account region

domain.explanation: To get access to your data, enter your Freshdesk domain (example.freshdesk.com).
domain.label: Domain

api_key.explanation: Enter a valid API key of a user with the <bold>Account Administrator</bold> role. You can obtain the API key in Freshdesk on your <bold>Profile Settings</bold> page.
api_key.label: API key

adapter.explanation: Select the database adapter that your ACD uses.
adapter.label: Database adapter

host.explanation: Enter the host and port of your database.

credentials.explanation: Enter valid credentials for a database user that has read-access to the ACD's databases

config.explanation: Name of the configuration database. This database contains tables such as cfg_dn and cfg_person. Not needed if you have a Postgres database.

etl.explanation: Name of the ETL database. This database contains tables such as qinfo and status.

host.explanation: Enter the host and port of your database.

credentials.explanation: Enter valid credentials for a database user that has read-access to the database <bold>"CCMData"</bold>.

timezone.explanation: In case the system running your Mitel ACD is not setup in UTC±00:00, select the local time zone of your system here.
timezone.label: ACD time zone

agent_status_active.explanation: injixo can import agent status data if the data is in the following tables within your database: tblConfig_Attributes_User_Employee, AgentTraceEventsStats, and tblConfig_Agent.
agent_status_active.label: Import agent status data

timezone.explanation: Select the time zone of your database.
timezone.label: Database time zone

host.explanation: Enter the host and port of your database.

credentials.explanation: Enter valid credentials for a database user that has read-access to the database <bold>"sk_acc_v5"</bold>.

credentials.title: API credentials
credentials.explanation: Enter valid API key and API secret for your Genesys Cloud ACD. The following permissions are required: <bold>"analytics:userDetail:view"</bold>, <bold>"analytics:userObservation:view"</bold>, <bold>"analytics:conversationAggregate:view"</bold>, <bold>"analytics:conversationDetail:view"</bold> and <bold>"routing:queue:view"</bold>.

region.explanation: Select the region of your Genesys Cloud account.
region.label: Account region

detailed_on_queue_status.explanation: injixo will differentiate the agent statuses that are summarized under the on-queue statuses, e. g. communication, interacting, idle, not responding.
detailed_on_queue_status.label: Import detailed on-queue agent statuses

subdomain.explanation: To get access to your data, enter your ujet subdomain.

company.explanation: Enter a valid company key and company secret code for your ujet ACD.

secret.label: Company secret code
secret.validation: Enter a valid company secret code

universal.description: Your ACD data can be imported either manually or via Xlink. Further details about how to setup and use Xlink can be found at <0>https://www.injixo.com/community/downloads</0>.

grouping.label: Grouping of calls
grouping.explanation: Select how you want to group your calls into queues.

data_source.explanation: Enter the name of the ODBC data source for your Avaya CMS database.
data_source.label: Data source

port.explanation: injixo Cloud Link will listen on this port to import real-time agent status data.
port.label: Port

detailed_statuses.explanation: injixo will add skills/split information to the agent statuses.
detailed_statuses.label: Import detailed agent statuses

domain.explanation: To get access to your data, enter your Zendesk domain (example.zendesk.com).

token.explanation: Enter valid credentials for a user with administrator role. You can obtain API tokens from the Zendesk Support admin interface at <bold>"Admin > Channels > API"</bold>.

grouping.explanation: The default grouping approach used is <bold>by group</bold>. Select this option to additionally create a source queue for every Zendesk <bold>brand</bold>.

call_grouping.explanation: Select how you want to group <bold>Zendesk Talk</bold> data into source queues.
call_grouping.label: Group the Zendesk Talk call queues by
call_grouping.validation: Select the grouping strategy of Zendesk Talk data

zendesk.preparation_info: To create view-based Zendesk queues, we need to fully import the ticket history up to the current point in time.

call_grouping.explanation: Select how you want to group Freshdesk Contact Center data into source queues.
call_grouping.label: Group queues by

api_key.explanation: Enter a valid API key of a user with the <bold>Account Administrator</bold> role. You can obtain the API key in Freshdesk Contact Center on your <bold>Profile Settings</bold> page.
api_key.label: API key

domain.explanation: To get access to your data, enter your Freshdesk Contact Center domain (example.freshcaller.com).
domain.label: Domain
domain.validation: Enter your Freshdesk Contact Center domain (example.freshcaller.com)

freshdesk_contact_center.support_link_title: Add a Freshdesk Contact Center integration

api_key.explanation: Enter a valid API key of a user with the <bold>Account Administrator</bold> role. You can obtain the API key from the <bold>API Tokens</bold> page under <bold>Admin > Configure</bold> in your Freshchat account.
api_key.label: API key

domain.explanation: To get access to your data, enter your Freshchat domain (example.freshchat.com).
domain.label: Domain

data_type.explanation: You can only select one type of import data at a time. To import data from another type, create a new integration.
data_type.label: Type of import data

db_type.explanation: Select the type of your database.
db_type.label: Database type

template.explanation: This SQL query will be executed every 15 minutes automatically. Learn more in <explanationLinkText>Help Center</explanationLinkText>.
template.label: SQL query
template.required: You have to specify the SQL query

timezone.explanation: Select the time zone of your database.
timezone.label: Database time zone

interval_length.required: You need to select an interval length

reconciliation.explanation: When the <bold>Data reconciliation</bold> checkbox is activated, injixo re-imports all data of the last 24 hours every 15 minutes. When the checkbox is deactivated, injixo only imports data from the last 15 minutes every 15 minutes. To access any data corrections within the last 24 hours, keep the checkbox activated. Learn more in <explanationLinkText>Help Center</explanationLinkText>.
reconciliation.label: Data reconciliation

rta_interval_clause.explanation: Enter an SQL clause to calculate the import interval (import interval = current time - interval seconds). This clause will be used in the SQL query above to enable the real-time import. Learn more in <explanationLinkText>Help Center</explanationLinkText>
rta_interval_clause.label: SQL clause for RTA interval

db_connection.explanation: Enter the host and port of the database. If you use a named instance on an MS SQL Server connection, do not enter a port. Learn more in <explanationLinkText>Help Center</explanationLinkText>.

db_credentials.explanation: Enter valid credentials for a database user that has read access to the database.

db_name.explanation: Select the database you want to connect.
db_name.label: Database name

db_connection_string.explanation: Enter a connection string to connect to your database. The connection string needs to be specific to your database type and ODBC driver.
db_connection_string.label: Connection string

credentials.explanation: Enter your client ID and password for Cisco ICM.

gateway_1.explanation:
Enter the addresses (as IP address or DNS name) and port numbers to be used. Separate addresses with commas. The first address is considered a Side A PG, and the second one a Side B PG. If you only enter one address, injixo assumes that no Side B exists.
E.g. “192.168.0.1:42027, 192.168.0.2:43027”.
gateway_1.label: Peripheral gateway 1
gateway_1.validation: Enter the information for your first peripheral gateway.

gateway_2.explanation: (Optional) Enter the information for your second peripheral gateway.
gateway_2.label: Peripheral gateway 2
gateway_2.validation: Enter the information for your second peripheral gateway.

acd_servers.explanation: Enter your ACD server address as DNS name (e.g. acdserver.example.com:8080) or as IP address (e.g. 192.168.1.1:8080). If you do not specify any port, injixo uses the default port 42027. For multiple ACDs, separate the addresses with commas.
acd_servers.label: ACD server addresses
acd_servers.validation: Enter a valid ACD server address.

timezone.explanation: Select the time zone of your ACD.
timezone.label: Time zone

break_labels.explanation: injixo will add the type of the break to the break statuses, e.g. Break (Lunch break) instead of Break. Changed break labels in Odigo are available in injixo after max. 4 hours. You need to update the activity mapping.
break_labels.title: Detailed break agent statuses

ws_login.explanation: Contact Odigo for detailed information and assistance.
ws_login.label: Web service user
ws_login.validation: Enter a valid web service username.

ws_password.label: Web service password
ws_password.validation: Enter a valid web service password.

wsdl_domain.explanation: Enter your Odigo URL that contains the tenant ID in the path, e.g. https://example.odigo.cx/odigo-tenant-id.
wsdl_domain.label: Odigo URL
wsdl_domain.validation: Enter your Odigo URL that contains the tenant ID, e.g. https://example.odigo.cx/odigo-tenant-id.

api_domain.explanation: In Odigo, this field corresponds to pef-api-domain.
api_domain.label: API domain

app_id.explanation: In Odigo, this field corresponds to pef-app-id.
app_id.label: App ID

contact_data.description:
The contact data for each day is imported at 3 AM.
Contact Odigo if you need more information.

instance.explanation: In Odigo, this field corresponds to x-ws-instance.
instance.label: Instance

ivr_timezone.label: IVR timezone
ivr_timezone.validation: Select the timezone of the IVR.

statistics_table_id.explanation: In Odigo, this field corresponds to statistics_table_id.
statistics_table_id.label: Statistics table ID
statistics_table_id.type_validation: The statistics table ID must be a number.
statistics_table_id.validation: Enter the Odigo statistics table ID.

contact_data.title: Contact data

user_name.explanation: In Odigo, this field corresponds to odigo-user-id.
user_name.label: User name

tech_account.explanation: In Odigo, these fields correspond to pef-tech-account and pef-tech-password.
tech_account.label: Tech account
tech_account.validation: Enter the tech account for connecting to Odigo auth API.

tech_password.label: Tech password
tech_password.validation: Enter the tech password for connecting to Odigo auth API.

ws_login.validation: Enter the username for connecting to the Odigo web service.

ws_password.validation: Enter the password for connecting to the Odigo web service.

url_token.creation_required: To generate the injixo URL token, save the integration first.
url_token.explanation: Generate a URL address to provide an RTA stream to record agent status changes.
url_token.label: injixo URL token

modal.key_deleted: When the new injixo URL token is generated, the current URL token will be deleted.
modal.key_exchange: You must replace the current URL token with the new one in Odigo.
modal.title: Generate a new injixo URL token

url_token.placeholder: The injixo URL token will appear once it has been generated.
url_token.title: Generate injixo URL token

plan_ng_message: We are developing new updates for this functionality. While we work on them, injixo cannot import agent status data, or use the data in Intraday.
